member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationLiveSetting
member.summary: Describes the notification characteristics of a particular live region.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationLiveSetting.Assertive
member.summary: The element sends interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, UI Automation clients and assistive technologies are expected to interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationLiveSetting.Off
member.summary: The element doesn't send notifications if the content of the live region has changed.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationLiveSetting.Polite
member.summary: The element sends non-interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, UI Automation clients and assistive technologies are expected to not interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationKind
member.summary: Indicates the type of notification when raising the UI automation notification event.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationKind.ActionAborted
member.summary: The current element has a notification that an action was abandoned.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationKind.ActionCompleted
member.summary: The current element has a notification that an action was completed.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationKind.ItemAdded
member.summary: Something that should be presented to the user was added to the current element.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationKind.ItemRemoved
member.summary: Something that should be presented to the user was removed from the current element.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationKind.Other
member.summary: The current element has a notification that is not due to an addition or removal of something, or to a completed or aborted action.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationProcessing
member.summary: Specifies the order in which to process a notification.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationProcessing.All
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. All the notifications from this source should be delivered to the user.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationProcessing.CurrentThenMostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. don't interrupt the current notification for this one. If new notifications come in from the same source while the current notification is being presented, keep the most recent and ignore the rest until the current processing is completed. Then use the most recent message as the current message.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationProcessing.ImportantAll
member.summary:
These notifications should be presented to the user as soon as possible. All of the notifications from this source should be delivered to the user.
IMPORTANT: Limit the use of this option, since delivery of all notifications to the user can cause a overwhelming flood of information.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationProcessing.ImportantMostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user as soon as possible. The most recent notifications from this source should be delivered to the user because the most recent notification supersedes all other notifications.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.AutomationNotificationProcessing.MostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. Interrupt the current notification for this one.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.IAutomationLiveRegion
member.summary: Provides support for UI automation live regions.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.Automation.IAutomationLiveRegion.LiveSetting
member.summary: Gets or sets the notification characteristics of the live region.
member.returns: The notification characteristics of the live region.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlace
member.summary: Represents an entry in a custom place collection for Windows Vista.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlace.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a custom place identified by a Windows Vista Known Folder GUID.
member.param: A that represents a Windows Vista Known Folder.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlace.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. with a specified folder path to a custom place.
member.param: A folder path to the custom place.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlace.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents this instance.
member.returns: A string that represents this instance.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlace.KnownFolderGuid
member.summary: Gets or sets the Windows Vista Known Folder GUID for the custom place.
member.returns: A that indicates the Windows Vista Known Folder for the custom place. If the custom place was specified with a folder path, then an empty GUID is returned. For a list of the available Windows Vista Known Folders, see Known Folder GUIDs for File Dialog Custom Places or the KnownFolders.h file in the Windows SDK.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlace.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder path to the custom place.
member.returns: A folder path to the custom place. If the custom place was specified with a Windows Vista Known Folder GUID, then an empty string is returned.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of Windows Vista custom places for the class.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection.Add(System.Guid)
member.summary: Adds a custom place to the collection.
member.param: A that represents a Windows Vista Known Folder.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a custom place to the collection.
member.param: A folder path to the custom place.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.HighDpiMode
member.summary: Specifies the different high DPI modes that can be applied to an application.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.HighDpiMode.DpiUnaware
member.summary: The application window does not scale for DPI changes and always assumes a scale factor of 100%.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.HighDpiMode.DpiUnawareGdiScaled
member.summary: Similar to , but improves the quality of GDI/GDI+ based content.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.HighDpiMode.PerMonitor
member.summary: The window checks for DPI when it's created and adjusts scale factor when the DPI changes.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.HighDpiMode.PerMonitorV2
member.summary: Similar to , but enables child window DPI change notification, improved scaling of comctl32 controls, and dialog scaling.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Forms.HighDpiMode.SystemAware
member.summary: The window queries for the DPI of the primary monitor once and uses this for the application on all monitors.

member.returns: The character used to define word breaks for text justification.

member.summary: Gets or sets the character to be substituted for characters not in the font.
member.returns: The character to be substituted for characters not in the font.

member.returns: The descent of characters in the font.
